paper_title: Stringent bounds for the non-zero Bernoulli numbers
abstract: We present new several sharper and sharper lower and upper bounds for the non-zero Bernoulli numbers using Euler's formula for the Riemann zeta function. As a particular case, we determine the best possible constants $ α$ and $ β$ such that the double inequality $$ \frac{2\cdot (2k)!}{π^{2k} (2^{2k}-1)}\frac{3^{2k}}{(3^{2k}-α)} < \vert B_{2k} \vert < \frac{2\cdot (2k)!}{π^{2k} (2^{2k}-1)}\frac{3^{2k}}{(3^{2k}-β)}, $$ holds for $ k = 1, 2, 3, \cdots.$ Our main results refine the existing bounds of $ \vert B_{2k} \vert $ in the literature.
